headline: Toasted Garlic Bread
description: This garlic toast recipe is packed with flavor thanks to a delicious combo of garlic, oregano, and mozzarella. A tasty addition to any Italian meal!

video.description: Slice, spread and broil for tasty, toasted satisfaction in minutes!
video.name: Toasted Garlic Bread

name: Toasted Garlic Bread

recipeInstructions.text: Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler. Cut loaf into ten 1-inch slices.

Mix butter, garlic, oil, oregano, salt, and pepper together in a bowl; spread butter mixture on one side of each slice of bread; arrange bread slices, butter-side up, in a single layer on a baking sheet.
Cook under the preheated broiler until slightly brown, checking frequently so they do not burn, about 3 minutes.
Top bread slices with cheese and return to broiler until cheese is slightly brown and melted, about 2 minutes. Serve hot.

review.reviewBody: I think it's all about getting the best bread IMHO. I followed most of the directions. I didn't use the added salt (my butter is salted) or pepper and I didn't add mozzarella cheese, I sprinkled grated parmesan cheese instead. Wonderful.

This is THE one I've been searching for! I used the recipe for 5 leftover bakery buns. Mostly doubled all the ingredients listed & based on what I had, used a mild olive oil, both fresh & jarred minced garlic at 2:1 ratio & did use shredded mozzarella. The recipe is SO good I'll use this it every time I make garlic bread, even without cheese. Thanks for sharing!
No, tasted better than the store bought brands! Thank you..
Made it several times. Just right.

If I could put 10 stars, I would. It was so amazing and it wasn’t greasy, which I really care about. It is so much better than that they sell at the store. ?? Also, it was really easy to make. While we waited for the bread to be done in the broiler, we took the ends of the loaf and dipped it in the small amount of spread that was left, and there is nothing in the bowl. NOTHING. It was good even without it being toasted, so you can put it on anything. Toast, sandwich’s, etc. it took 15 minutes and it was amazing with the tomato soup we had. I would and will make this again. 10 out of 10. Bravo. Amazing. Thank you to the creator of this recipe.
Bread was wonderful. I have already made it again.

I sliced the loaf in half lengthwise and baked the garlic bread in the oven (rather than broil it). It turned out delicious! I didn't add the mozzarella either, as it was so good without it. I'm definitely making this again the next time we have Italian dinner night. It was so much better than the store bought, premade garlic bread.
I loved making this recipe, I first tried for myself and I made for the whole family it's really easy and it's soo mouth-watering. I loved it thank you
Quick and easy way to make garlic bread that will have people talking. Absolutely delicious!
This is a great and simple way to make delicious garlic bread. Served it for a family gathering and everyone was asking if I made it!
This was so yummy, I made it as written except did like others stated and buttered the full loaf and then broiled. It is definitely a keeper and way better than store bought garlic bread.

The flavor is really great! I was concerned about the amount of garlic that goes into the mixture. I was worried the flavor would be too strong but actually, it could stand for a little more garlic. The whole family enjoy this recipe and I will certainly make it again.
Easy and delicious!
Best garlic bread ever! I left out the salt and pepper but other than that made no changes. Will use this recipe from now on.
Excellent! The addition of olive oil really takes it over the top. We had this with Carol’s ziti casserole from the site and it was one of our favorite meals. Will use again and again!
Topped the toast with pecorino-romano grated cheese and broiled both sides to make the bottoms of the slices crunchy as well. Came out delicious! Will make it again!
This was great. Just the right amount of butter, garlic and other spices.
Thank you so much for sharing this recipe!!! It was delicious!!!

This was ok for a garlic bread. I scaled down the recipe to what I needed to make for me using a gluten free ciabatta bread/roll I wanted to use up and followed the package directions for baking it. Appreciated the use of fresh garlic instead of garlic powder in this recipe, but something just seemed to be missing flavor wise...maybe more butter and roasting the garlic first would have worked...not sure. I also used parmesan cheese as that's what I had on hand and followed Bookie's recommendation on this recipe to lightly cover with foil. Decent recipe, but again, something was just off/missing to me.
Great way to make garlic bread. Used fresh mozzarella pearls.
Excellent! Followed the recipe exactly.
I made this with regular bread off the shelf and everyone enjoyed it, so I am sure with fresh high-quality bread it would be absolutely fantastic. Very simple and flavorful.
I by accident added a little extra black pepper and salt but it was still very good! Five-star food!

Everyone here liked the garlic spread, but no one was a fan of the mozzarella on top. My broiler burned these at 2 minutes, so I remade them and pulled at 30-40 seconds; added mozzarella and broiled about 30 seconds more. Minus star because we thought the cheese detracted from the savory taste.
I don't have any pics because everyone ate it too fast!

I didn’t use any pepper, spread it on “half baked bread” from Trader Joe’s (which I sliced in abt 1-2in width), & let it cook in the oven for 8min & it was perfecttt. The flavors sunk into the bread as it cooked.
Super easy and delicious! Had store bought garlic bread and this homemade recipe at a big family dinner the store bought kind was the only kind left over. They usually love the store stuff Lol
This was easy and great. I did have to watch mine in the broiler. Only about 2 to 3 mintues tops for browning. Used cheddar cheese instead.

I didn't have Italian bread available, but this still worked great with some rolls that I had on hand. I added a little fresh dried parsley to the mixture, topped with parmesan cheese and baked open-faced at 425degF for 10 min. Came out excellent! UPDATE 3/7/19: To make this even quicker, I sliced a large roll in half, spread each side with butter and spritzed with garlic olive oil, topped with pieces of minced garlic, dried oregano, parsley and grated romano cheese. It came out SO good and had nice crunch. Just have to make sure you don't keep in oven too long or you may burn the garlic.
Very good, we loved it. My boyfriend was in charge of the baking and burned some of it, but that's not your fault!! It was yummy, and well, fun too cuz I got a good laugh. thanks!
Followed the recipe loosely (without measuring). It was so good! Will make it again
I Did not make any changes .and love it .Thank you !
Super quick and easy and turned out great
Thank you! A lifesaver when you forgot to make it and don't have time to spend firing up the oven. Remember, you can soften butter in the microwave in under 15 seconds!

Really easy & tasty. Just like the prebuttered one you can buy in the store, minus all the chemical preservatives. 

I cut the loaf in half lengthwise, applied spread, wrapped foil & baked as directed. 

Then unwrapped from foil & placed under broiler for few minutes to crisp it up. Watched it carefully under broiler to make sure it didn't burn. Delicious side for our pasta main dish.
This was so quick to make and very good! The bread had a strong garlic flavor which we loved. Next time I would leave off the mozzarella and eat as is.
Rather than cutting the loaf into slices to start. it is much easier to halve the bread and prepare...then cut into servings.
Can't go wrong with these ingredients. Be careful these are addictive.

This was great! I modified the recipe a bit by adding 3 tablespoons of oil and leaving out the cheese. Since it was accompanying lasagna, I didn't want too much cheese. They came out delicious and the whole party loved it! I will definitely make this again.
broil is a bad idea. burnt the toast. bake at 350°
I made this exactly according to the recipe and it was delicious and perfect.
Delicious! Will definitely be making this again.
Great and easy! So much better than using the frozen garlic toast. I used shredded Parmesan and it had great flavor.
Easy. Similar to "Texas toast." Used about twice as much garlic, though.

I was not happy with the results for this. I had nowhere near enough mix to cover the bread, so it was spread so thinly that there was no flavour. I ended up just cutting it up and using it has croutons in my Caesar salad so it didn't go to waste.

This is amazing. We all loved the butter sauce and the cheese topping. My husband ate more of this than the main dish. He said wherever you got this recipe keep it. This is sooo good! The only change I made was the bread. We had naan bread that I had to use and it was really tasty. I will def be making this as our go to garlic bread from now on vs store bought. Thank you!!
I made it with cheddar and Parmesan cheese since that's all I had and it turned out fantastic.
So easy and quick. Family enjoyed it . This is a keeper.
Yummy recipe! Used Parmesan instead of mozzarella.
Yum! Everyone loved it
OMG! This garlic bread is to die for! Made the recipe exactly as written and got rave reviews from my husband and son. This may become my go to recipe for garlic bread. Make it - you won't be sorry!

Really enjoyed this recipe. It even works on sliced sandwich bread (I was trying to use up the loaf before it went stale). I refrigerated the leftovers (must be cooled completely before putting in fridge to keep moisture out) warmed them up in the oven the next day and it was still good.

We like to buy the fresh Italian loaf of bread from the grocery store. After a couple days the bread hardens. We usually make croutons but I tried this instead. Great way to use up the Italian bread. I made it exactly as the recipe reads and I tried a different version with garlic salt instead of garlic power and salt. It was acceptable but not as good as the original.

This was wonderful! I didn't have any cheese on hand so made it without. Even my kids who don't like the store bought garlic bread had seconds of this. I ran out of the first batch & had to make more. I only used a few pieces of thickly cut bread & put the extra butter in the fridge for more another time. Watch while broiling, though. My first batch scorched after 1 1/2 minutes when it was on high. I lowered the broiler temp for the second batch & that one was about 5 minutes.
Simply outstanding......
The garlic bread was amazing ! I liked how all flavors were mixed together to make a delicious side dish. I would make this again whenever I have a chance.
Simple and pretty good
Delicious and I also reduced amount of oregano and added parmesan cheese to butter.

I made this with Ciabatta and it really knocked out socks off! At first I was just going to use 2 roasted cloves of garlic but then I saw this recipe and added one raw, chopped clove. Also some leftover garlic/Rosemary/salt rub from the steaks we grilled for dinner. Skipped the mozzarella and oregano. We grilled this on the BBQ open because we ran out of foil. Let me tell you BEST GARLIC BREAD EVER!
I followed exact and think this is really a tasty, decent garlic bread for how little effort it took to make it. Will use again!

I had half of a loaf of day old sour dough and quickly looked up a garlic bread recipe while our pasta was cooking. I am very impressed with this recipe and likely won't buy store bought frozen garlic bread again because this is too easy.
I usually cook frozen garlic bread. This was easy and fast. I didn't have cheese. It was still awesome. Kids loved it, too.

Made it twice this week. The first time on thick bread spread on a cookie sheet. Baked for a few minutes, then added shredded parmesan and broiled for a couple minutes. Tonight i used a french loaf sliced end to end and wrapped in foil, baked it at 450 for 20 minutes. Perfection both times. I also made the butter mixture during the day with jarred minced garlic so the flavors melded. And this morning i made my scrambled eggs with the garlic butter. Yum!
Great herb mix in the butter. Watch closely as mine went from not ready to very dark in about 30 seconds more!

Roasted a whole garlic head (not cloves) in the oven 350 for about 20 min. Just chopped the top off a little so can see the garlic cloves and drizzled with small amount of olive oil. Once done, peeled off the garlic skin, minced and mixed with the rest of the ingredients. Right before putting in the oven, also lightly drizzled some more olive oil on the bread-covered with foil and baked in the oven for about 10 minutes at 350 degrees. Checked mid way just in case so it didn't burn. The bread came out nicely crisp on the outside and edges, but still chewy and moist on the inside. Family LOVED it and it was not overpowering. Will absolutely make again with this same prep.
Thank you very much! Its the first time i make garlic bread, so im glad i chose ur recipe. My mom and little sister loved it! So now im the garlic bread expert. Thanks again.
had the munchies.. liberally applied the mixture to a couple day old sub rolls. very happy with the result
Fantastic. We all loved it. I have tried quite a few garlic bread recipes over the years and this is by far the best. Easy, too!

Unfortunately, I was not too impressed with this garlic bread, the oregano took over the rest of the ingredients and the amount of garlic was quite overpowering. I would recommend putting only 1 clove of garlic in the mixture and less oregano.
Way better than a lot of restaurants! A little less garlic next time maybe though.
delicious and easy
The whole family loved them! I put a little piece of moz cheese in the middle just to add a little something - five stars with or without it though. Thank you for the recipe!
Just wanted one slice of bread to try it so I used 1 T butter, 1/4 t olive oil, dash garlic powder, salt and oregano. Wish I had made more!
I didn't deviate from this recipe at all and it was the best garlic bread I've had anywhere, even at a restaurant.

This recipe is very good! Easy to make and can turn old bread into nice and toasty fresh bread! I used some "french bread loaf" I had in the refrigerator and honestly this transformed the bread into a tasty toasted garlic flavored piece...will make it again....since I had a small piece of bread I have left overs for spreading on other breads and toasting. My only suggestion would be always keep an eye on the broiler...it can be tricky as it can burn anything quite quickly!

Love this recipe! Changed it up a bit though. Instead of using French bread, I had used sour dough bread and omitted the mozzarella cheese. My husband said it was the best garlic bread he has ever had yet!
Okay but I would not likely make again.
I made it just as described...but used Herbs de Provence instead of oregano. When I say yummy...I mean YUMMY!
Great garlic bread. I bet you didn't know garlic bread can be messed up, but for what ever reason I struggle making it. I followed this recipe and vwala I made good bread.
Very good!
This was very good and easy. The boyfriend asked what did I use because he was surprised to how good it tasted. This will be my go to recipe going forth.
REALLY GOOD EASY Should always have butter frozen for a fast garlic bread when no time to make other breads.
Seasoning was perfect! I followed the recipe exact, using Texas Toast a larger slice of bread. I was able to make 6 slices of this toast.

Needed garlic bread for a side, and didn't have the olive oil this recipe called for - added a little extra butter, and it turned out great anyway. Will definitely make sure to have the olive oil next time though.
Excellent garlic bread. I did skip the cheese and it was still fantastic. Thanks!
Simple, effective, and addicting. I look for excuses to make this once a week!
Very tasty. I used leftover Italian Herb bread, had to use garlic powder because that was all I had. Great use for the leftover bread and quick and easy to throw together.

I had to whip this together very quickly so I didn't use crushed garlic but garlic powder. :-( I will use the right ingredients as I'm making this again today! I like the addition of the mozzarella at the end.
Best basic garlic bread! I did not use the mozzarella this time. So much better than the frozen loaves with weird yellow goo...
A perfect variation from the original recipe.
Yum, delicious! I didn't have Italian bread so I used a baguette instead and baked at 350 for 10 minutes.
Made this as an appetizer just as the recipe said, but used French baquettes. Everyone loved it! Super easy and tasty!
Nice change from the "too salty" traditional garlic bread recipes. Will make this again. But, will not broil it, but simply bake it to a crisp.
Loved it! I used focacccia bread and didn't need to spread a lot on mine. Very good, everyone loved it!
I love this. I make it every family function. They go crazy for this!
This was really easy to make and really good. My kids said it was the best garlic bread they ever had.
This was so easy and so good! I used sourdough bread and basil instead of oregano.

This was delicious !! I used all the ingredients and broiled one horizontal half of Italian bread on low for about ten minutes then I added some shredded mozzarella and parsley flakes and broiled for another 2-3 minutes. It came out toasty and the butter and cheese gave it a nice yellow cheesy inside. Yummmm ! Wish I made more :)
Don't usually both putting cheese on top; however, it is yummy
